intro: Nototriche discolor, commonly known as the variable nototriche, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or white, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Nototriche discolor is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves to survive dry conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
